quiz_pages.title: Early Position with Aces
quiz_pages.description: You're in early position with pocket Aces. What's your play?

feedback.correct: Correct! Raising 12BB in early position with Aces is the optimal play.
feedback.incorrect: Not quite. With Aces in early position, you want to raise to build the pot while not scaring away too many players.

quiz_pages.title: Ace King in Cutoff Facing Raise
quiz_pages.description: You're in the cutoff with AKs. What's your play?

feedback.correct: Correct! AKo is a strong hand that plays well in position against the raiser.
feedback.incorrect: With AKo in the cutoff, raising is typically the best play to take initiative and potentially win without seeing a flop while dominating many strong hands like AQ and KQ.

quiz_pages.title: Small Blind with Suited Connectors
quiz_pages.description: You're in the small blind with 87s facing a raise. What's your play?

feedback.correct: Correct! Out of position, we want to fold or 3-bet bluff -- this may get a nice fold from a stronger hand, or your cards still have great chances against big cards.
feedback.incorrect: With suited connectors in the small blind, folding is safe and re-raising puts fold pressure on opponents and allows you to potentially win a big pot when you hit a straight or flush.

quiz_pages.title: Big Blind with Small Suited Connectors
quiz_pages.description: You're in the big blind with 65s facing a raise. What's your play?

feedback.correct: Correct! Calling with suited connectors in position is a good play.
feedback.incorrect: With suited connectors in the big blind, calling allows you to see a flop cheaply and potentially win a big pot when you hit.
